intro: Selinum sium, commonly known as mountain celery, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent reminiscent of celery. Selinum sium is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes.
